He owns adjacent parcels at 229 and 231 Skyland Drive ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/robert-antici#:~:text=231%20Skyland%20Dr%2C%20Belton%2C%20SC%2C,current%20address)) and has no documented involvement in local development discussions ([scbiznews.com](https://scbiznews.com/anderson-planned-development-proposals-flounder-with-controversy/#:~:text=keeping%20economic%20growth%20out%20of,businesses%2C%20farms%20and%20property%20values)).

neighbors.name: Daniel Corey Richey
neighbors.claims: A fence on the Richey property line has stood since 1936, indicating long-term family ownership of the land ([app.midpage.ai](https://app.midpage.ai/document/richey-v-county-of-anderson-10603849#:~:text=feet%20at%20Mr,northern%20property%20line%20since%201936)). In 2000, county officials attempted to extend a road (Catrina Lane) through the Richeys’ land; the Richey family sued to block it, defending their property rights against public access ([app.midpage.ai](https://app.midpage.ai/document/richey-v-county-of-anderson-10603849#:~:text=Richey%20to%20inform%20him%20that,would%20remove%20it%20for%20him)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted community figure meet one-on-one, acknowledging the Richey family's long tenure on the land and assuring the project will respect his property boundaries and rights.

neighbors.name: Oscar BP Properties LLC
neighbors.claims: Oscar BP Properties LLC holds at least two parcels in Anderson County (PINs 225-00-06-012 and 225-11-017-05) according to county property records ([andersonrecords.org](https://andersonrecords.org/property-records#:~:text=Anderson%20County%20property%20records%20constitute,with%20South%20Carolina%20state%20law)) ([andersonrecords.org](https://andersonrecords.org/property-records#:~:text=The%20Anderson%20County%20Register%20of,property%20information%20to%20the%20public)). The LLC does not appear in South Carolina’s business entity registry under that exact name, implying it may be organized out-of-state or under a different name, with no publicly listed local officers ([secretaryofstate.com](https://secretaryofstate.com/south-carolina/#:~:text=Run%20the%20%E2%80%9CSearch%E2%80%9D%20by%20selecting,the%20appropriate%20button)) ([www.andersoncountysc.org](https://www.andersoncountysc.org/#:~:text=IMPORTANT%20NOTICE%2812,to%20public%20information%20from%20ACPASS)). No liens, UCC financing statements, or litigation records were found connected to Oscar BP Properties LLC in available public databases, suggesting minimal public financial activity ([secretaryofstate.com](https://secretaryofstate.com/south-carolina/#:~:text=Run%20the%20%E2%80%9CSearch%E2%80%9D%20by%20selecting,the%20appropriate%20button)) ([www.mossyoakproperties.com](https://www.mossyoakproperties.com/land-for-sale/south-carolina/ranches/?pg=101#:~:text=South%20Carolina%20Ranches%20for%20Sale,style)). There is no media coverage or community meeting records referencing this company, indicating its principals have not openly taken positions on development proposals in the area ([www.mossyoakproperties.com](https://www.mossyoakproperties.com/land-for-sale/south-carolina/ranches/?pg=101#:~:text=South%20Carolina%20Ranches%20for%20Sale,style)) ([secretaryofstate.com](https://secretaryofstate.com/south-carolina/#:~:text=Run%20the%20%E2%80%9CSearch%E2%80%9D%20by%20selecting,the%20appropriate%20button)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Out-of-state or private investor holding land; no evident local business operations or political engagement

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the LLC’s managing party through official mailing address; highlight financial incentives or buyout offers given their investment focus; be prepared that they may remain neutral or driven purely by price considerations

overview_summary: All five profiled neighbors have no documented stance for or against the development, leaving their positions unknown. None hold formal public office or notable leadership roles, and community influence appears limited – only one household (a local contractor–realtor couple) shows moderate influence through business connections. All five neighbors maintain a low public profile with no known stances on development or clean energy projects. None holds an official position in Anderson County or has been visible in community debates, and all are considered low-influence in terms of community impact. All five profiled neighbors have an **unknown stance** (none have publicly stated support or opposition to the development). They are predominantly private landowners with **low** community influence; none hold public office or prominent leadership roles locally. All five profiled neighbors have no documented stance on local development or clean energy (5 unknown). None holds a public office or leadership role, indicating low individual influence across the board. They appear to be ordinary residents without significant community clout. All five profiled neighbors are private landowners with no documented public stance on the development. All are classified as low-influence residents, as none hold notable civic roles. Stances remain unknown, with none on record explicitly supporting or opposing the project. All three profiled neighbors have no documented stance on local development or clean energy. None hold notable public positions or leadership roles in Anderson County. All appear to be private landowners with limited community influence and would need direct outreach to gauge their views. Two neighboring landowners are locally-registered LLCs holding rural parcels in Anderson County. Neither appears to have public profiles or disclosed ownership beyond basic property records. One is a farm-oriented entity (Six O Ranch LLC) and the other a property investment entity (Oscar BP Properties LLC), with limited evidence of community involvement or stated positions on development. Both seem primarily concerned with their landholdings and have not been identified in public sources as major community influencers or vocal opponents/supporters of development.
